text.author: Wiktionary
text.title: trust
text.summary: This dictionary entry for the word 'trust' provides its etymology from Middle English 'trust' and Proto-Indo-European *deru- 'be firm', cognates such as Danish trøst, pronunciations like /trʌst/ and /trʊst/ and synonyms, antonyms, usage examples and definitions as a noun (e.g. 'confidence', 'hope'), senses in computing and law, and as a verb meaning to have faith or believe.
